name.en: Ministry of Home Affairs (India) Foreign Contributions (Regulation) Act Register

description.en:
The Foreign Contributions (Regulation) Act required NGOs in receipt of foreign funding in India to register with the government. They are assigned an FRCA Registration Number.

Lists of registered organisations can be found online by state and year: https://fcraonline.nic.in/fc8_statewise.aspx

access.onlineAccessDetails: A full search service for identifiers does not appear to be available. However, a service is available from the website to verify identifiers: https://fcraonline.nic.in/fc_reg_certificate_details_verification1.aspx. This will return information on the address and validity of an FRCA certificate when an identifier is supplied.
access.guidanceOnLocatingIds:
Some states appear to publish lists of local FRCA numbers, and a web search for an organisation name and 'FRCA' may identify it's number, which can be verified through the FRCA Online website. 

Organisations may also be able to provide their own identifiers.
